pages.text: Okay, my little test subject, time to show us what you've been up to down there... What are you doing? Stop bashing those rocks together and listen.$(br2)The task after this one is all about infrastructure, but before we can teach you about logistics you need to $(item)send up$() some samples of the ores you acquired at the $(l:sim_3/resources/1_minerals_and_ores#barrier)Barrier$().
The $(item)Amadron Tablet$() can be used to exchange items & liquids with us.$(br2)To set a Pickup/Dropoff location you will $(item)SHIFT + Right Click$() an inventory or tank.
The $(item)Charging Station$() can charge items with the $(item)Pressure$() that is being supplied from external sources.$(br2)Use it to charge the $(item)Amadron Tablet$().

We will give you the $(l:sim_3/knowledge/0_ae2)Logistics Knowledge$() after you send us some $(item)Charged Certus Quartz$().$(br2)If you do this for us we might even stop it with the caveman quips! Wouldn't that be nice?

pages.title: Pressure Chamber
pages.notes: You will also need to manufacture some components from the $(item)Pressure Chamber$().$(br2)A $(item)Pressure Chamber$() is a multiblock structure made up of a mix of the above blocks in a 3x3x3 or 5x5x5 configuration.$(br2)The chamber should be hollow.

pages.text: $(item)Walls$() and $(item)Glass$() makes up the walls of the cube and can be placed anywhere.$(br2)You will need atleast one $(item)Chamber Valve$() to import pressure into the chamber.$(br2)The $(item)Chamber Interface$() are used to import/export items out of the chamber and you will need atleast one of each to be able to craft in the chamber. The mode of the interface is decided by which way the block is facing.
Interfaces only accept to import/export by cabling, you cannot transfer things manually.$(br2)Make sure to filter the export interface so input items does not get exported as they enter the chamber.
